nodes.long_description:
The VR4VET Blue Sector VR app simulates an area of a fjord with several fish cages, a feeding station, a fish health and welfare station, and a fish processing facility. The users can experience situations representing typical workplaces in the aquaculture and fish processing industries, such as feeding salmon in multiple cages, inspecting fish for injuries and diseases, and sorting, cutting, and packaging fish in a factory.
The application can be used as a supplementary material for the end users integrated into the career guidance and vocational education practice. When in the application, the user takes the role of a trainee at various workplaces in the blue economy sectors, those related to the oceans, seas and coasts. The user is introduced to the professions and can engage in typical workplace tasks.
The app features:
- Fish feeding station, where the user can observe salmon in three fish cages using a special underwater camera, adjust the feeding intensity to keep the fish well fed without wasting the food, and get feedback on their performance.
- Fish welfare station, where the user can observe a typical procedure in aquaculture when a sample of fish is checked for diseases and injuries. The user can perform the check and get feedback on their performance.
- Fish processing facility, where the user can observe how the salmon is received, sorted, processed, packaged and shipped for delivery. The user can perform several typical tasks and get feedback on their performance.
nodes.short_description: The VR4VET Blue Sector VR app simulates a large area of a fjord with several fish cages, a feeding station, a fish health and welfare station, and a fish processing facility under construction. The users can experience situations representing typical workplaces in the aquaculture and fish processing industries, such as feeding salmon in multiple cages, inspecting fish for injuries and diseases, and sorting, cutting, and packaging fish in a factory.

pdp_metadata.publisher_name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

nodes.change_log:
Blue Sector v1.9. includes a fish feeding scenario, a fish welfare scenario, a fish maintenance scenario,  a fish factory scenario, and a fish laboratory scenario.

# Change Log

## Added:
- We added Norwegian translation for most text content in the application, including the virtual tablet’s pages, the hand controller tooltips, and the loading screen. NPC dialogues, however, are still only available in English.
- We added an accessibility option for larger text size, which affects various objects in the application.
- We added an option for disabling the permanent teleport tooltip when controller tooltips are enabled.
- The NPC in the Bleeding Station will respond to the errors the player can make
- We made more user interface elements respond to the higher contrast mode added in version 1.8.

## Changed:
- We made the virtual tablet snap properly into the player’s hand when grabbed, making it easier to handle and interact with.
- We made the permanent teleport tooltip hide itself when the virtual tablet is held in the player’s right hand, to prevent it from being obstructed by the tooltip.
- We removed languages that were not fully supported from the Pause Menu’s language settings page.
- We made the language setting persistent, preventing the selected locale from resetting every time the application is stopped.
- We made the hand controller tooltip detection radius match the player grabber’s radius, meaning that the labelled actions will be performed when the right button is pressed.

## Fixed:
- We made the Pause Menu always reachable with the player’s laser pointers, making it always easily available no matter where the player is positioned.
- The Fish Feeding scenario’s “Press A to start the game” sign that appears when the feeding task is ready to start no longer flickers, and its hand controller model with its A button highlighted is restored. 
- The Fish Maintenance scenario no longer breaks if the dead fish falls onto the floor.
- The hand controller tooltips no longer appear if the player moves their hand controller while their in-game hand is snapped to a grabbable object (e.g., levers etc.)
- The Fish Laboratory scenario’s fish can now always be picked up even after having visited other scenes prior to entering the laboratory.
- We improved the performance in the Fish Laboratory scenario.

## Developer:
- The Fish Maintenance scene, like the application’s other scenes, now relies on the virtual tablet’s WatchManager class, and not the MaintenanceManager class.

Blue Sector v1.8. includes a fish feeding scenario, a fish welfare scenario, a fish maintenance scenario,  a fish factory scenario, and a fish laboratory scenario.

# Change Log

## Added:
- We added mini tooltips that label the hand controller button actions. This functionality triggers when the player’s hands are close to most interactable objects. This functionality can be enabled in the pause menu’s new accessibility settings. 
- We added a higher contrast mode for the virtual tablet which can be enabled in the pause menu’s new accessibility settings.
- We added signs and posters showing where fish should be sorted in the quality assurance task of the fish factory scenario.
- We implemented the new virtual tablet that correctly presents the task structure and progression for the Fish welfare and Fish laboratory scenarios.

## Changed:
- The NPC in the laboratory better positions itself in the room, while the user is working on a specific task.
- After responding to an error, the NPC in the Fish laboratory will return to the exact point it left off.
- The NPC has a more realistic and accurate pointing animation.
- The instructions for the Bleeding station of the Fish factory scenario have been changed to be easier to understand. The corresponding NPC has new walking and pointing functionality.
- The virtual tablet and task structure have been updated in the fish feeding scenario.
- The player can retry the calculation of the condition factor without having to start at the beginning of the task in the Fish laboratory scenario.
- The Fish laboratory NPC will no longer interrupt the player before they are done writing down the properties of the fish. 

## Fixed:
- The tablet task for the Gutting station in Quality assurance task of the Fish factory scenario is correctly updated when discarding bad fish.
- We fixed a bug where the player can go out of bounds in the reception area.
- The fish anti-stretch mechanism now works in all scenes. The fish now behaves more naturally when stretched while held with one hand.
- The player no longer falls through the reception scene’s dock. 

## Developer:
- The walking functionality for the NPC’s have been reworked. Now it works in all scenes and is much easier to implement.
- We added constraints for the NPC right arm and its fingers. Making arm movement and gestures more accurate and flexible.
- The pointing functionality of the NPC is automatically available in all scenes, with no required setup. The dialogue tree’s “Point At” attribute now takes in a scene object’s name, making it flexible and easy to make NPCs point at specific scene objects. The “isPointing” attribute has been removed as it was unnecessary, only setting the “Point At” attribute will make it point.
- An event with arguments containing relevant information is called when the dialogue is changed. It  can greatly reduce the required code complexity when developing more complex NPC dialogue behaviour.
- The game will no longer give an error message when the player collides with NPC’s without dialogue.

Blue Sector v1.7. includes a fish feeding scenario, a fish welfare scenario, a fish maintenance scenario,  a fish factory scenario, and a fish laboratory scenario.

# Change Log

## Added:
- The laboratory NPC now walks towards the selected task’s working area.
- Text-to-speech buttons have been added to the informational sheets next to the microscope in the laboratory scenario.

## Changed:
- The laboratory scenario’s NPC no longer asks if the player wants to hear instructions for each step in the condition factor task.
- The laboratory scenario’s microscope has had its lens magnifications changed to 4x, 10x, 20x, and 40x to improve realism.
- The laboratory scenario’s water sample has had its plankton count greatly reduced to make it more feasible to complete the plankton counting task.
- The laboratory scenario’s NPC now mentions that the water sample used in the plankton counting task is simplified, compared to reality.
- The 360 videos in the fish maintenance scenario are now replayable, rather than disappearing after being played once. They now disappear when the player progresses further.
- The hints above the 360 videos in the fish maintenance scenario are now written in English.
- The NPC in the fish factory scenario’s bleeding station is named “Bernard” instead of “Bent”.
- The NPC in the fish factory scenario’s bleeding station has had his dialogue corrected when talking about welfare standards.
- There is less overlap in the answers of the introduction dialogue of the NPC in the sorting task in the factory scenario’s quality assurance room. 

## Fixed:
- We fixed a bug where the laboratory NPC’s dialogue broke when placing incorrect objects on the scale in the condition factor task.
- The laboratory task no longer breaks when interacting with the microscope while receiving feedback from the NPC.
- It is no longer possible to teleport onto the laboratory room’s ceiling.
- The NPC will now return to its initial rotation after it finishes pointing.
- The laboratory scenario’s microscope now has the correct lens positioning corresponding to the displayed magnification level.
- The fish maintenance scenario NPC’s button for progressing the dialogue is no longer blocked by invisible elements and is always reachable.
- The fish factory scenario’s bleeding station NPC no longer breaks when his dialogue progresses past the section about welfare standards.
- NPCs’ dialogue boxes now rotate when the NPCs themselves turn, making the dialogue text always face forwards.

Blue Sector v1.6. includes a fish feeding scenario, a fish welfare scenario, a fish maintenance scenario,  a fish factory scenario, and a fish laboratory scenario.

# Change Log

## Added:
- We added the plankton counting task, giving the microscope in the laboratory scenario a real use case.
- We added text-to-speech to tool tips, the tablet, the start tutorial, and the main menu.
- We added posters that show the different quality tiers of salmon in the quality assurance station and the different states of gutted fish in the gutting station.
- We gave NPCs the ability to point with their hands, which is now used in the laboratory scenario to show which objects the NPC is talking about.

## Changed:
- We made minor changes to the dialogue in the fish factory scenario to make it easier to understand.
- We moved the conveyor belt activation button in the gutting station of the fish factory onto the platform where the player operates the machinery, making it easier to reach.
- We made the spaces between the steps of the stairs in the bleeding station of the fish factory impassable to prevent players from accidentally teleporting through the stairs and onto the floor underneath.
- The button for skipping NPC dialogues is now grayed out when a section is unskippable.
- The choice between basic and advanced difficulty modes in the fish feeding scenario is now integrated into the NPC’s dialogue, rather than the physical buttons on the table.
- The scale in the laboratory scenario is moved further away from the device used to enter answers to prevent unwanted placements of objects on it when interacting with the scale.

## Fixed:
- We fixed a bug where the “Handling of dead fish” subtask in the maintenance scenario did not trigger consistently.
- We partially fixed a bug where the player could spawn at incorrect coordinates after scene transitions.
- We fixed a bug where the player could drop the tablet onto the floor in the fish factory scenario.
- We made the anesthetic bottle unable to be placed in the player’s pocket to prevent unwanted overdosing of fish in the fish welfare scenario.
- We made the knives in the bleeding station appear on the table where they should be discarded if they fall through the floor.
- We disabled collisions between the player and various objects in the fish factory scenario to prevent unwanted elevation when picking up objects.
- We made it impossible to place the 360 video headset into the player’s pocket in the bleeding station of the fish factory.
- We made the speedboats used for traveling between scenes move consistently up and down, preventing them from hovering or being submerged under the water.
- We prevent the player from getting stuck on the ocean floor in the reception area and the fish maintenance scenario by moving the player back to their initial spawn position if positioned too low.
- We fixed an issue where fish can be stretched in the fish factory scenario by forcing the player to let go with one of their hands if stretched past a threshold. If a fish gets stuck on an object in the scene while held with one hand, the fish is teleported towards that hand.
- The NPC returns to the correct part of its dialogue when the player does an incorrect action in the laboratory scenario.
- We fixed an issue where the NPC dialogue wouldn’t finish properly on branch points.

## Developer:
- The project’s unit tests had to be deleted to make the BNG framework’s namespace visible to the fish factory scenario’s scripts. This was necessary to correct the player’s position after scene transitions. They can easily be restored using the project’s Git history.

Blue Sector v1.5. includes a fish feeding scenario, a fish welfare scenario, a fish maintenance scenario,  a fish factory scenario, and a fish laboratory scenario.

# Change Log

## Added:
- We added a new reception scene that works as a central hub, connecting all current virtual workplace environments. 
- We added a loading screen for scene transitions that shows the loading progress of the next scene.
- We made task-related objects in the laboratory scenario return to their initial position when the player completes a task.
- We made the NPC in the laboratory scenario react if the player performs the procedure steps in the wrong order.

## Changed:
- We moved the starting tutorial to the reception area.
- We translated the NPC dialogue in the maintenance scenario into English.
- We replaced the watch in the maintenance scenario with the tablet.
- We updated  the dialogue in the fish laboratory to be more precise and realistic.

## Fixed:
- We fixed some of the NPC dialogues in the maintenance scenario.
- We made it impossible for the player to get stuck on the ocean floor after falling into the water in the maintenance scenario by teleporting the player back onto the boat.
- We removed the ability to change player hand models by pressing the right thumb stick, which often happened accidentally and made players unable to perform tasks.
- We fixed a rounding error in the Condition Factor calculation in the fish laboratory scenario, which sometimes made players fail even when performing the task correctly.
